timeline.bodyText: Wondering if we should make beans a LinkedHashSet instead? Not sure how iterating on the bean list for each synthetic bean will slow us down at bootstrap for large number of beans.
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Hm, we do iterate over all beans quite often and since a typical quarkus apps will have hundreds of beans at most I don't think it's worth the effort...
replies.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: I'm surprised by the ifFalse here?
timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText: Could we avoid the lambda in runtime code?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Of course we could ;-). Although we used lambdas even before this PR...
replies.author: mkouba

timeline.bodyText: Could we avoid the lambda in runtime code?
timeline.author: gsmet

timeline.message:
ArC - cleanup and optimizations

- AbstractSharedContext - replace Key with bean identifier
- ComputingCache - add computeIfAbsent() methods
- Generated beans implement equals()/hashCode() (based on bean
identifier)
- fail fast if multiple synthetic beans have the same bean identifier

identifier)
- fail fast if multiple synthetic beans have the same bean identifier
